plan.description: This layout maximizes the feeling of spaciousness by strictly adhering to a perimeter arrangement. All furniture is placed against the walls, leaving the entire central floor area open and creating clear, wide pathways. This creates distinct, functional zones for sleeping, living, and working without cluttering the small footprint.

furniture_placement.chair_1: Positioned at table_1, on the side closer to the center of the room.
furniture_placement.chair_2: Positioned at table_1, on the side closer to the left (west) wall.
furniture_placement.nightstand_1: Against the right (east) wall, placed to the top side (head) of bed_1.
furniture_placement.nightstand_2: Against the right (east) wall, placed to the bottom side (foot) of bed_1.
furniture_placement.table_1: Against the top (north) wall, between the kitchenette area and the main living space.
furniture_placement.sofa_1: Against the left (west) wall, positioned in the lower half of the room.
furniture_placement.artwork_1: Mounted on the left (west) wall, centered above sofa_1.
furniture_placement.plant_1: Placed in the corner where the top (north) and right (east) walls meet, next to nightstand_1.
furniture_placement.artwork_2: Mounted on the right (east) wall, next to nightstand_2.
furniture_placement.rug_1: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, in front of the left window.
furniture_placement.rug_2: On the floor against the bottom (south) wall, in front of the right window.

plan.door_clearance: The area directly in front of the door is completely clear, providing an unobstructed path into the main open space of the room. The nearest furniture is the dining table, which is positioned well to the left and more than three feet away.

zone_arrangement.work_zone: The work/dining zone is established along the top (north) wall, adjacent to the kitchenette for convenience.
zone_arrangement.sleep_zone: The sleep zone is consolidated along the entire right (east) wall, creating a dedicated and private resting area.
zone_arrangement.living_zone: The living zone is situated along the left (west) wall, utilizing the length of the room for seating and relaxation.
